list-item.label: â€¢
list-item.p: The small-molecule drug ST-294 inhibits the replication of Junin and other New World arenaviruses, while the benzimidazole derivative ST-193 targets the Old World agent, Lassa virus ( Bolken et al., 2006, Larson et al., 2008). Based on mutagenesis studies of the virion surface GP2 molecules, both compounds interfere with viral entry, but the specific mechanism is not known.
